techmeme.title: A look at Rebind, a mysterious startup that turns Margaret Atwood and other authors' voices into AI reading companions, and an interview with CEO John Dubuque (Laura Kipnis/Wired)
Framework partners with DeepComputing to build a RISC-V mainboard for its Laptop 13, set to become one of the first RISC-V laptops; price and release are TBC (Sean Hollister/The Verge)
Netflix plans to open two permanent in-person experience venues, in Dallas and near Philadelphia, in 2025, a continuation of its previous pop-ups (Todd Spangler/Variety)
How generative AI model providers can create business models that reward copyright holders and content creators, much like what has happened on the web (Tim O'Reilly/O'Reilly Media)
The US surgeon general's call for social media warning labels seems to ignore evidence and may feed into a moral panic, similar to prior panics over video games (Mike Masnick/The Daily Beast)
